\n
Company Description
\n
Ulbrich was established in 1924 and is family-owned and privately held. An international corporation with subsidiaries located in the US, Mexico, Germany and Austria. Ulbrich employs over 700 people worldwide.
\n
At Ulbrich, we are
Improving Lives with More Than Metal.
We work hard for each other, our families, and the communities we live in. The respect and integrity of Ulbrich team members, dedication to their professions, collaborative participation in lean, and ensuring that safety comes first, has created a culture that has a positive impact on the lives of many. We connect with the world through our responsibility to produce critical products that benefit mankind.
\n
The Ulbrich culture is guided by a set of shared values we call
Our Core Tenets
.
The tenets we live by each day are Continuous Improvement, Quality Commitment, Family Values, Total Company Involvement, and Customer Responsiveness. Through practicing these shared values, we drive profitable growth and success.
\n
Come join the Ulbrich team and become part of a greater purpose and a promising future!
Job Description
\n
Ulbrich Stainless Steels and Special Metals Inc. is looking for a detail-oriented
Power BI Developer/Data Analyst
. This entry-level role based at our corporate headquarters in North Haven, CT is ideal for individuals passionate about data visualization, analytics, and business intelligence. You will work closely with business stakeholders to transform raw data into actionable insights using Power BI and other analytical tools.
\n
Responsibilities include:
\n
\n
Develop and maintain Power BI Dashboards and reports to support business decision-making;
\n
Perform data cleaning, transformation and modeling to prepare datasets for analysis;
\n
Collaborate with business teams to understand requirements and translate them into effective visualizations;
\n
Monitor and optimize report performance and implement best practices for BI solutions;
\n
Assist in ad-hoc data analysis and generate insights to support operation and strategic initiatives; and
\n
Document process, data models, and report standards for future reference.
\n
Qualifications
\n
\n
0-2 years of experience in information systems
\n
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Data Analytics
\n
Basic knowledge of Power BI (or similar BI tool) and data visualization principles
\n
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
\n
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts)
\n
Understanding of ETL process and data warehousing concepts
\n
Exposure to DAX and Power Query in Power BI is a plus
\n
Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
\n
Additional Information
\n
This position offers competitive salary and benefits and the opportunity to expand your skills within a company that offers both a diverse workforce and a welcoming company culture.
\n
Ulbrich is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
\n
